channel.title: [Important] Remove all objects?
channel.description: Okay well I've gotten farther on my flawless dodian source, and I came across a problem. I started adding some objects of my own and deleting un-needed objects that are taking up space that players could roam around. After an hour of deleting pointless objects I noticed that its just too time consuming and generates way too much lag when loading the game. Is there a possible way I could just remove all current RuneScape objects either client sided or server sided so I can just add the only objects needed myself? This would be a big breakthrough for many people. If someone knows a way of doing this, please help me and I can make a tutorial for everyone.

item.title: [Important] Remove all objects?
item.dc:creator: @Halflingblade Halflingblade
item.description:
@Halflingblade wrote:

[quote=“patargangstar, post:5, topic:388756”]pi or delta base? if its pi objecthmanager.java

search for “public void loadCustomSpawns(Client c) {”

the seemingly repetitive lines under that are all your spawns, for example

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(6552, 3090, 3510, 3, 10);
Id Coordx Coordy[/quote]

Are you fucking serious? I just explained in my last reply that is not what I mean, and no thats not how you do it. Read before you post

Read full topic

item.title: [Important] Remove all objects?
item.dc:creator: @Halflingblade Halflingblade
item.description:
@Halflingblade wrote:

Yeah but it still doesn’t remove the object in-game, it just removes the setting for that object. What I mean is I want to remove all of the original objects that are in the game before any editing ever took place. For example I want to log in seeing no objects at all except for the objects that I added myself, without generating any lag.

Read full topic

item.title: [Important] Remove all objects?
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

server sided. Look at how the objects are stored and then remove them all. Keep one for preference

Read full topic
